file_content.text: I'll be out of here before they notice I'm gone. Thanks again!
Been monitoring you on the security network. You sure know how to make an entrance.
Guess we found our slicer--but why does this room look like a prison?
Because it is a prison. Thanks for noticing.
Whatever issues you're having with the guild, I'm on your side. I'm just a slave here.
Your name's Kixi, right?
I've been looking for you.
That's my nickname--short for Kixiaralu. You... you came here for me?
Relax, kid.
Then is there any chance you're here to free me? Because I'm definitely ready to not be here.
You don't look like a slave to me.
Don't lie.
If I try to leave this room, they'll shoot me. Does that sound free to you?
The guild locked me up two years ago. Forced me to work for them. I'll do anything to get out. What do you need?
Put me on Skavak's trail and I'll free you.
I need information first.
Finding his trail is easy. Just look for the slime.
Skavak is the only thing I'm here to talk about, sister.
No negotiations.
"Sister"? Who calls people that?
Tell me everything you know about Skavak or you're dead.
Don't make me kill you.
Take it easy, Captain. This poor girl's willing to help.
He came from a broken home and has serious intimacy issues. Also, I make bad jokes when people threaten to kill me.
I knew that Corellian pig-lizard Skavak had ticked off the wrong person. No wonder he was in such a hurry.
Skavak paid the guild to clean his identity record. They made me slice into the Republic's main database and delete all his arrest warrants.
You just cracked open the Republic's database and changed things?
You can do that?
It's what I do. The Republic administrators never even knew I was there.
No wonder Skavak gets around so easily--nobody's chasing him but me.
Explains why he's free.
He mentioned some Sullustan lawman giving him trouble.
Knowing Skavak, you spent a lot of time deleting things.
I'll bet you were busy.
It's like he's trying to set a record for the biggest criminal of all time.
Sorry, but that's all I know about Skavak. Not sure how else to help you.
Isn't there some way to figure out where Skavak is?
I need to find him.
Do you know how many people are on Coruscant? It takes a lot for one man to stand out. Hang on... maybe that's it.
I want you to make that scum's life miserable.
Hurt Skavak bad.
I don't know about miserable, but I think I can put him on the defensive.
You're not going anywhere unless you give me something useful.
You want out of here or not?
What if... what if I undo everything I did for him? That might be useful, right?
Take away his spotless identity record, and Skavak can't walk ten meters without attracting attention. He'll be a lot easier to find.
I can ruin Skavak's identity record for you in no time. If I do that, will you let me go?
I want Skavak's record dirtier than a sewer on Hutta.
It's a deal.
In other words, just the way I found it. No problem.
Show me what you can do to him, first.
We'll see.
I've been slicing the Republic's main databank for years. There's nothing I can't do.
Destroy Skavak's identity or I'll destroy you.
No deals.
Not the hero type, huh? Figures. Nobody good ever comes here.
I saved copies of everything I erased from Skavak's identity record. All I have to do now is transfer the data back....
There, easy. The minute he passes an identity checkpoint, it'll trigger an alarm.
What else can you do to Skavak's identity record?
So many possibilities....
Depends how much damage you're looking to inflict.
Frame him as an undercover Republic law enforcement agent.
Destroy his criminal contacts.
You really hate him, don't you? All right, I'll plant files with all the criminal syndicates so they think Skavak is a lawman.
Make it so no woman in the galaxy will ever touch him again.
Keep him lonely.
I'll register him as a plague carrier. Give him a nice case of Bothan Nether Rot. That'll keep the girls away.
Give him a death sentence on every Republic world.
I want him dead.
Easy enough. I'll register him as a Sith spy and... done. If he's ever caught in Republic space, he'll be shot on sight.
A gangster put a price on my head. Can you fix that?
Can you clean my record?
Thing about gangsters is, getting in trouble with them is easy. Getting out? That's something else. Sorry, I can't help you there.
Okay. Let me go now, so I can make it out before they lock this place down.
I was always planning to let you go.
All right, get moving.
Thank you! You're my hero!
I won't mind a bit if you kill some more of those guild thugs on your way out....
You're more useful to me if I know where to find you.
Sorry, I might need you again.
I can't believe you're doing this! Then again, maybe I can.
You and Skavak deserve each other....
No, you can't. [Kill her]
Let's make sure those changes stay permanent.
Keep it that way. [Kill her]
Wait, don't!
Captain, are you out of your mind? You just shot that poor girl!
It was a necessary evil, Corso.
Had to be done.
Necessary how? She was no threat to us.
She could've warned Skavak about us.
She was a liability.
The guild forced her to help Skavak. You shoulda just let her escape.
Never question my decisions again, understand?
Shut your mouth.
I'm not your droid, Captain. Stuff like this is hard on my conscience.
I didn't sign on with you to kill innocent women. You'd better remember that from now on.
Maybe we should go check in with Darmas--see if he's got any new info on Skavak.
Please!
Please, don't hurt me. If anybody asks, I'll tell them I never saw your face.
Did you change your mind about letting me go? Please, I can't take it in here!
I cleared you a path. Run for it!
You're free.
I don't know why you changed your mind, and I don't care. Goodbye!
If Skavak comes back to see you, I want to know.
Stay here and be my spy.
If Skavak comes back, it'll be to kill me. You're the worst person I've ever met, and I hang out with slavers!
Death is better. [Kill her]
Wait, stop!
Captain, what the hell are you doing? You led us all the way back here just to kill this girl?
She knew too much, Corso.
Had no choice.
You coulda turned her loose! Smashed her computers! You didn't have to execute her.
Get over it.
I'll risk my neck for a good cause, but there's nothing good about what you just did.
And I'd do it again in a heartbeat.
Sure looks that way.
I thought you were a decent person, Captain. Guess I better revise that opinion.
Don't ever involve me in something like this again. I mean it.
Agh!
Let's get out of here and crack open that Black Sun security console.
